item.title: Bioimaging

item.title: Genome Annotation
item.description: Table of Contents Genome Annotation Gene Ontology Annotation BLASTX Blast2GO GO Semantic Similarity Analysis G-SESAME | Gene Semantic Similarity Analysis and Measurement Tools clusterProfiler | GO semantic similarity analysis : Genome annotation GOToolBox | GO semantic similarity analysis : DNA sequence analysis SML-Toolkit | Semantic Measures Library Toolkit Promoter Predication FirstEF | First Exon Finder CpGpromoter PROmiRNA Annotation Workflows RAST | Rapid Annotation using Subsystem Technology Prokka | Annotation workflows BlastKOALA Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Genome Annotation Genome annotation is a key process for identifying the coding and non-coding regions of a genome, gene locations and functions.

item.title: Metabolic Profiles
item.description: Table of Contents Metabolic profiles analysis Metabolic Network analysis BLASTX PiMP | Polyomics integrated Metabolomics Pipeline Metabolite enrichment analysis MetScape | Data integration : Mass spectrometry analysis FELLA | Metabolite enrichment analysis MS-based untargeted Metabolomics mGWAS MWASTools | mGWAS RegScan NMR-based Metabolomics/MS-based targeted metabolomics Spectral corrections NMRPipe NMRPro Spectral deconvolution NMRPipe BATMAN | Bayesian AuTomated Metabolite Analyser for NMR data Chemometric analysis MetaboAnalyst speaq | spectrum alignment and quantitation Metabolite identification W4M | Workflow4Metabolomics MetaboAnalyst Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Metabolic profiles analysis The further development of spectroscopic and spectrometric tools for high throughput analyses of selected biochemical pathways is crucial to the acquisition of metabolome data sets of sufficient quality for metabonomics and metabolomics.

item.description: Table of Contents Protein Sequence Analysis Amino Acid Repeat Prediction RADAR REPRO Subcellular Localizaton Prediction TargetP pRoloc Protein Clustering CD-HIT USEARCH MS-based (Mass Spectrometry) untargeted Proteomics 2D gel Image Analysis digeR Plasmo2D In Silico Analysis OpenMS multiplierz Phosphorylation Site Assignment Ascore Phosphonormalizer PTM Identification PIQED SUMmOn Glycosylation Identification SugarQb MAGIC MS-based Metaproteomics Unipept MPA Antibody Array Analysis PANDA Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Protein Sequence Analysis Protein sequence analysis tools are used to predict specific functions, activities, origin, or localization of proteins based on their amino-acid sequence.

item.title: RNA Transcription
item.description: Table of Contents Transcription analysis Prognostic Biomarker Identification KM plotter cBioPortal Region Discrimination CPC CNCI Gene co-expression prediction GeneMANIA WGCNA Gene regulatory network inference NIR GRAM Gene set enrichment analysis GSEA DAVID RNA-seq analysis Gene fusion detection Segemehl Subread Alternative splicing events identification Cufflinks Gene expression array analysis Prognostic biomarker identification KM plotter cBioPortal Differential expression DESeq agriGO Metatranscriptomic sequencing analysis Prediction-base Taxonomic MetaBAT Homology-Based Taxonomic MEGAN | MEtaGenome ANalyzer Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Transcription analysis Transcript abundance is in many ways an extraordinary phenotype, with special attributes that confer particular importance on an understanding of its genetics.

item.title: DNA Structure
item.description: Table of Contents DNA Structure Shape prediction do_x3dna 3DNA DINAMelt DNAshape R-loop forming sequence prediction QmRLFS-finder DNA Structure Database R-loopDB | R-loop forming sequence databases Small-angle Scattering AXES FoXS AquaSAXS Find more tools: OMICTOOLS DNA Structure DNA molecules exist in many different conformations, including A-DNA, B-DNA, or Z-DNA forms, which depend on the nucleotide sequence, hydratation level, presence of metal ions, etc.

item.title: Nucleosome Positioning
item.description: Table of Contents Nucleosome Positioning NuCMap | Nucleosome positioning : Epigenomics nuMap | Nucleosome positioning : Epigenomics ICM | Interactive Chromatin Modeling MNase-seq analysis PING nucleR NOrMAL ATAC-seq analysis NucleoATAC | Nucleosome positionning analysis : ATAC-seq analysis Find more tools: OMIVTOOLS Nucleosome Positioning NuCMap | Nucleosome positioning : Epigenomics Maps directly nucleosome centers. NuCMap is based on chemical modification of engineered histones.

item.title: Prediction of Protein Structure
item.description: Table of Contents Primary structure ProtParam COILS Secondary structure PredictProtein PSIPRED tertiary structure Phyre Swiss-PdbViewer Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Primary structure Protein primary structure is the linear sequence of amino acids in a peptide or protein. By convention, the primary structure of a protein is reported starting from the amino-terminal (N) end to the carboxyl-terminal © end. Protein biosynthesis is most commonly performed by ribosomes in cells.

item.title: Computational Neuroinformatics
item.description: Table of Contents Biological Steps Realistic Neuronal Network Modelling The Virtual Brain Brian Compartment Neuron modelling NEURON neuroConstruct File Manipulation Model Files Conversion SBML2LaTeX Sbmlharvester Model Files Visualization SBMLToolbox SBMLEditor Model Building NeuroManager PyNN Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Modelling in computational neuroscience is becoming a crucial tool for understanding how experimentally observed properties of neural systems emerge from lower-level biophysical processes.

item.title: Drug Discovery
item.description: Table of Contents Drug Discovery Drug-drug interaction prediction DDI-CPI | Drug-Drug Interaction via Chemical-Protein Interactome Hierarchical RNNs model-based DDI extraction Ligand-based Virtual Screening FTrees | Feature Trees Frog | FRee On line druG conformation generation Drug Repositioning DRRS | Drug repositioning recommendation system MANTRA | Mode of Action by NeTwoRk Analysis Chemical Toxicity ChemDes | Chemical toxicity : Drug design Molecular editors Bioclipse | Molecule editors : Drug design MCCE | Multi-Conformation Continuum Electrostatics Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Drug Discovery In the fields of medicine, biotechnology and pharmacology, drug discovery is the process by which new candidate medications are discovered.

item.title: Genome Editing
item.description: Table of Contents Genome Editing CRISPR/Cas9 sgRNA Design CRISPR design GuideScan E-CRISP CRISPRscan TALEN design TALE-NT TALEN Targeter ZFN Design Zinc Finger Tools ZifNN ZFN-Site CRISPR/Cas9 Screen Analysis CREATE | CRISPR-enabled trackable genome engineering MAGeCK | Model-based Analysis of Genome-wide CRISPR/Cas9 Knockout MAGeCK-VISPR caRpools | CRISPR-AnalyzeR for pooled screens Genome Editing Database Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Genome Editing Programmable nucleases - including zinc-finger nucleases (ZFNs), transcription activator-like effector nucleases (TALENs) and RNA-guided engineered nucleases (RGENs) derived from the bacterial clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeat (CRISPR)-Cas (CRISPR-associated) system - enable targeted genetic modifications in cultured cells, as well as in whole animals and plants.

item.description: Table of Contents RNA Modifications Analysis Protein-binding Region Prediction RNAcompete catRAPID omics RBPmap Alternative Splicing Annotation APPRIS rPGA Exogean RNA Methylation Prediction SRAMP iRNAm5C-PseDNC m6Apred Methylated RNA Immunoprecipitation Sequencing Data Analysis (MeRIP-seq Analysis) Spliced Read Alignment TopHat HISAT | Hierarchical Indexing for Spliced Alignment of Transcripts Subread Peak Calling ExomePeak | Peak calling : MeRIP-seq analysis MeTPeak De novo motif discovery Weeder HOMER | Hypergeometric Optimization of Motif EnRichment MEME Suite Degradome-seq Analysis sPARTA package CleaveLand Find more tools: OMICTOOLS RNA Modifications Analysis From a biosynthetic point of view, the roughly 100 known different RNA nucleotide modifications can be easily divided according to their complexity.

item.description: Table of Contents Biological Steps Constraint based methods fastcore COBRA Toolbox | COnstraints Based Reconstruction and Analysis Metabolic pathway prediction EC-BLAST RetroPath Strain design Biopathway Predictor cRegMCSs | constrained regulatory MCSs Thermodynamics SSTMap | Solvation Structure and Thermodynamic Mapping von Bertalanffy 13C-fluxomics COBRA Toolbox | COnstraints Based Reconstruction and Analysis C13 | 13C-fluxomics : Metabolomics Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Growing concerns over limited fossil resources and associated environmental problems are motivating the development of sustainable processes for the production of chemicals, fuels and materials from renewable resources.

item.title: RNA-Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents CLIP-seq Analysis Peak Calling DFilter CLIPper Motif Discovery RNAmotifs MEMERIS miRNA Target Site Detection MicroMUMMIE MIRZA Ribo-seq Analysis Ribosome P-site Localization RiboProfiling riboWaltz Ribosome Stalling Prediction ROSE Translated ORF Prediction ORF-RATER Find more tools: OMICTOOLS CLIP-seq Analysis Cross-Linking Immunoprecipitation associated to high-throughput sequencing (CLIP-seq) is a technique used to identify RNA directly bound to RNA-binding proteins across the entire transcriptome in cell or tissue samples.

item.title: Non-Coding RNA
item.description: Table of Contents Non-Coding RNA Analysis miRNA Target Prediction TargetScan PicTar psRNATarget miRNA Enrichment DIANA-miRPath FAME | Functional Assignment of MicroRNAs via Enrichment miTEA miRNA-disease Association Prediction miRPD MCMG RNAi Reagent Design RNAxs WMD | Web MicroRNA Designer E-RNAi High-throughput RNAi Screening cellHTS CARD Small RNA sequencing Data analysis (sRNA-seq Analysis) tRNA-derived RNA Annotation tRF2Cancer HAMR ncRNA Identification miRDeep omiRas IsomiR detection DeAnnIso isomiR-SEA miRNA Array analysis InCroMAP AgiMicroRna Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Non-Coding RNA Analysis Noncoding RNAs (ncRNAs) accomplish a remarkable variety of biological functions.

item.title: Phylogenetic Data Analysis
item.description: Table of Contents Phylogenetic inference MEGA ADAPTML Phylogenetic Network Construction CLC bio SPRDist Discrete Character Evolution CAFE DupliPHY Tumor Progression CT-CBN TRONCO Tree Visualization Dendroscope TreeKO Find more tools: OMIVTOOLS In biology, phylogenetics is the study of the evolutionary history and relationships among individuals or groups of organisms (e.g. species, or populations). These relationships are discovered through phylogenetic inference methods that evaluate observed heritable traits, such as DNA sequences or morphology under a model of evolution of these traits.
